tier.item: `We were able to speak Leko, but we do not want to speak (it).'
We were able to speak Leko, but we do not want to speak (it).

o- bora-aya `your friends' o-moki kuchi-aya `your dogs'
ko- bora-aya `his/her friends' ko-moki kuchi-aya `his/her dogs'
cho- bora-aya `our friends' cho-moki kuchi-aya `our dogs'
b. soboto -ki di-min -a ka-te henwai kis-no-ki
`He has seen the soboto (a giant flying insect) who killed spiders.'
He has seen the soboto (a giant flying insect) who killed spiders.
`My children, tell me, does God exist?'
My children, tell me, does God exist?
My brother has beaten me up.
I don't like that chicha (maize beer).
(10) on kuchi senen tanta yin-k'o-a ka-te
`That dog ate all the bread, to my detriment.'
on kuchi senen tanta yin-k'o-a ka-te
That dog ate all the bread, to my detriment.

bar `flat' bar kach `lie flat' bar kich `lay flat
He is sitting on the stone.
`He made him sit on the stone.'
He made him sit on the stone.
(14) carambas heka dañu yi-ki-a ka-te-s misi-aya
`Damn, you have caused me trouble, you cats.' (Bear Story)
carambas heka dañu yi-ki-a ka-te-s misi-aya
Damn, you have caused me trouble, you cats.' (Bear Story)
He is making them carry sugarcane.
`He did not let the woman be short of food, one says.' (Bear Story)
He did not let the woman be short of food, one says.' (Bear Story)
`The pumas really annoyed him, it is said.' (Bear Story)
The pumas really annoyed him, it is said.' (Bear Story)
b. tomako tomako osito osito on do-koscho-tar-no-aya
`Tomaku, Tomaku, little bear, bear, they made him annoyed.'
tomako tomako osito osito on do-koscho-tar-no-aya
Tomaku, Tomaku, little bear, bear, they made him annoyed.
a. `Their father did not want them to go outside.' (reading in Bear Story)

I have forgotten your name.' (Bear Story)

tier.item: (25) baykia hep'aq-ne cho ki-no ch'aya-ki thah-no atspai-ki...
ant-TOP itch CAU-NOM people-DAT bite-NOM child-DAT
`The big ant (type) makes one itch, it bites people, children; it bites, it
also bites men, that ant.' (Ant Story)

tier.item: (26) chera hote-te-an ho lal-da dañino-aya soboto on-ne...
with-MT-1PL this earth-LOC harmful-PL insect that-TOP
... on soboto-n kis-no-te k'eso-ki kis-no-te henwai-ki...
that insect-TOP kill-NOM-MT snake-DAT kill-NOM -MT spider-DAT
... on-chka do-soh -in-kama-te ni ha-ka on animal-ki...
`We have in this region harmful creatures, one is the soboto; that soboto
kills snakes, it kills spiders; at the moment it is fighting with a snake,
with a hap snake from nearby no one can look at him, at that animal.'
chera hote-te-an ho lal-da dañino-aya soboto on-ne...

kills snakes, it kills spiders; at the moment it is fighting with a snake,
with a hap snake from nearby no one can look at him, at that animal.

tier.item: (28) ber mesa chika-la phel-a mesa-te sok'och chika-la soncho-no...
one table very-well lay-PP table-LOC food very-well smell-NOM
`There was a table very well laid out, on the table food, very well it
smelled. He felt hungry, tomaku; he ate it, it is said.' (Bear Story)
